doesn’t necessarily enable you to rule — it just enables you to destroy." GRRM

summary: There’s a lot of crazy fan theories about the hairstyles’ symbolism on the show. How has Sansa Stark’s hair evolved with her...
body:
There’s a lot of crazy fan theories about the hairstyles’ symbolism on the show. How has Sansa Stark’s hair evolved with her character?

It’s true, there’s definitely a correlation. For so long, Sansa’s hair changed season by season depending on who was influencing her. The first few episodes she was a Northerner in Winterfell and took after her mother with a simple braid down the back. Then, when she went to King’s Landing it was a big, decadent halo that was very much like what the Queen wore. With Littlefinger, she dyes her hair black and wears all black.

Then, she goes back to Winterfell and returns to her mother’s hair. She created her own identity in season 7 and that kind of runs through to season 8. She’s chosen how she wants her hair to be, and she’s finally the leader and influencer instead of being influenced by everyone else.

Sophie Turner on Sansa Stark’s hair evolution- InStyle Jan 16, 2019

I should preface this by saying that this interview is very recent since InStyle also asked her about the crypt teaser.

Now, back to Sophie’s answer: finally an official confirmation that Sansa’s hairstyle in the new teaser is not an inspiration from one of Dænerys 100+ hairstyles.

Sansa returned to her mother’s hair and she used more northern hairstyles since season 6.

In season 7 her hairs also contribute to show that she now knows who she really is and what she wants… and it will be the same for season 8.

Sansa is a leader now  ( Lady of Winterfell and de facto QiTN during Jon’s absence) and she won’t be influenced by Dænerys or by Dothraki ( yeah, crazy as it seems, I read that she will use Dothraki braids in season 8).

Thanks for saying it Sophie

blog.name: catthewall
blog.title: THECATTHEWALL
blog.description: Mostly blog about GOT... Sansan in particular. Love to attempt to do artful things but mostly just looking for story’s and art that make me feel all the feels!!

summary: My wish part 3
body:
My wish part 3

Jon and Dany are taking a walk in the godswood when they hear something coming from the trees. Dany gets behind Jon and he pulls out longclaw and demands the person to come forward. Sansa comes out a little flustered and clearly annoyed. She snaps that she was only taking a walk and praying. Jon looks concerned as her hair is out of place and her dress is wrinkled. He mentions it and Sansa blush’s while trying to fix herself. Dany clearly knows what’s up and try’s to pull Jon along but he insists he must help his sister back to the castle. They go back and forth and that’s when Sandor walks out offering to help the lady back. Realization hits jon and he’s left sputtering at Dany while the couple make their way back to the castle.

summary: My Wish part 2
body:
My Wish part 2

I wish that Arya does a sneak attack when she and Jon reunite. He catches her but they fall in the mud and it’s all hugs, kisses, crying and laughing. I hope she lets her hardass slip and is a puddle of goo around her big bro bro. 🥰🥰🥰

Also she shows him how good she’s gotten with needle and he’s just so proud and happy for her. He’s just super supportive as she tells him about her list. Just an all around amazing big brother and little sister relationship.

And maybe… she corners Dany and lets her know that if she hurt her brother she will kill her but then smiles like a psychopath so Dany isn’t sure if she kidding or not. That’s when the camera pans out to Sansa in the back just nodding slowly with her side smirk and icy eyes. Like “yeah bitch we mean it.”

tags: but maybe i'm wrong and there's evidence to contradict this
summary: It’s interesting that when people create arya + sansa giftsets of “two sides of the same coin” line that they make sansa related...
body:
It’s interesting that when people create arya + sansa giftsets of “two sides of the same coin” line that they make sansa related to the sun, and arya comparable to the moon. 

for me, the way the characters are, i’ve always seen it as the opposite. arya has always been more related to the sun; pro-sociality (making a great deal of friends with anyone), intensity of friendship, adventure and movement, work and labour. there is always a sense of activity with arya that i generally associate with the sun. 

whereas sansa’s temperament is much more melancholy, immobile (at least narratively speaking), there is definitely a sort of idealism that comes from stories and songs that is highly imaginative…and dreamlike. much more applicable to a still, starry night.

for me, the way the characters are, i’ve always seen it as the opposite. arya has always been more related to the sun; pro-sociality (making a great deal of friends with anyone), intensity of friendship, adventure and movement, work and labour. there is always a sense of activity with arya that i generally associate with the sun.

summary: In case we really get a kidnapping plot: I just realised how much I would love it if Cersei is the one that recognizes Sansa's...
body: In case we really get a kidnapping plot: I just realised how much I would love it if Cersei is the one that recognizes Sansa’s feelings for her “brother” and openly mocks Sansa for resembling herself. Oh, the irony.
